'''Troye Sivan''', born '''Troye Sivan Mellet''' (born 5 June 1995), is an [[Australian]] [[child actor]] and [[singer]]. He played [[Wolverine (comics)|Young James Howlett]] in the ''[[X-Men]]'' film ''[[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]]'',<ref name="stm">{{cite web |url = http://www.news.com.au/perthnow/story/0,21598,23297937-5012990,00.html |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5iXxOZCz1 |title = Perth boy to play young Hugh Jackman in Wolverine movie |accessdate = 31 January 2009 |archivedate = 26 July 2009 |author = Harvey, Shannon |date = 29 February 2008 |publisher = ''[[The Sunday Times (Western Australia)|The Sunday Times]]'' }}</ref> and most recently starred in the film ''[[Spud (film)|Spud]]''<ref name="stn">{{cite web |url = http://www.troyesivan.com/news16_spudrole.html |title = Troye plays lead role in Spud - The Movie |accessdate = 2 February 2010 |date = 2 February 2010 |publisher = troyesivan.com }}</ref>
==Biography== ===Personal life=== Sivan was born in [[Johannesburg, South Africa]]<ref name="bio">{{cite web |url = http://www.troyesivan.com/about.html |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5iXxUD9fc |title = Biography |accessdate = 31 January 2009 |archivedate = 26 July 2009 |publisher = troyesivan.com }}</ref> and lives in [[Perth, Western Australia|Perth]], [[Australia]]. He is [[Jew]]ish and is currently being homeschooled.
===Music=== Sivan has sung at the 2006, 2007 and 2008 [[Channel Seven Perth Telethon]].<ref name="stm" /><ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.troyesivan.com/news04_telethon2008.html |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5iXxZ3isl |title = Troye sings at Perth's Telethon 2008 |accessdate = 31 January 2009 |archivedate = 26 July 2009 |date = 22 October 2008 |publisher = troyesivan.com }}</ref> His 2006 performance included a duet with ''[[Australian Idol]]'' winner [[Guy Sebastian]].<ref name="stm" /> Sivan made it to the grand finals of StarSearch 2007.<ref name="bio" /> His debut album, ''Dare to Dream'' was released in February 2008. The CD includes five songs "There's a Hero", "[[Angels Brought Me Here]]", "[[Somewhere Over the Rainbow]]", "Unsung Hero" and "[[The Prayer (Celine Dion and Andrea Bocelli song)|The Prayer]]".<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.freewebs.com/troyesivan/ |title = Troye Sivan - 'Dare To Dream' |accessdate = 10 May 2008 |publisher = Dare to Dream website }}</ref> On 20 September 2008, Sivan sang in the opening of Storm the Stage at the [[Burswood Entertainment Complex]].<ref>{{cite web |url = http://www.troyesivan.com/news03_stormthestage.htm |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5iXxgPNm2 |title = Troye opened 'Storm The Stage' 2008 |accessdate = 31 January 2009 |archivedate = 26 July 2009 |date = 21 October 2008 |publisher = troyesivan.com }}</ref> In February 2010, Sivan opened the "[[We Are The World 25 for Haiti (YouTube Edition)]]", the collaborative music charity video produced by [[Lisa Lavie]] to help raise money for the victims of the [[2010 Haiti earthquake]].
===Acting=== In 2007, Sivan starred as Oliver Twist in a production of ''[[Oliver!]]'' at the [[Regal Theatre]].<ref name="stm" />
In February 2008, Sivan was cast as [[Wolverine (comics)|Young James Howlett]] in ''[[X-Men Origins: Wolverine]]''. Sivan got the part after videos of his Telethon performance were posted on [[YouTube]], catching the attention of a Hollywood agent who contacted Sivan and asked him to send in an audition tape.<ref name="stm" /> Though [[Kodi Smit-McPhee]] was already cast for this role, he was unable to be a part of the film, due to his other film, ''[[The Road (2009 film)|The Road]]''.<ref>{{cite news |url = http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,25197,23320029-16955,00.html |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5iXxiyyut |title = One for the road clears the path |accessdate = 31 January 2009 |archivedate = 26 July 2009 |author = Bodey, Michael |date = 5 March 2008 |newspaper = [[The Australian]] }}</ref>
In 2008, Sivan was cast in a West Australian short film, ''Betrand the Terrible''.<ref>{{cite news |title = Bertrand the Terrible - LINK funded film |first = Yvette |last = Coyne |url = http://www.fti.asn.au/blogs/production-support-report/2010/02/bertrand-the-terrible---link-f.php |publisher = [[Film and Television Institute]] |date = 16 February 2010 |accessdate = 6 July 2010 |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5r0skWmOp |archivedate = 6 July 2010 }}</ref>
In July 2009, he auditioned successfully for the lead role in ''[[Spud (film)|Spud]]'', a film adaptation of [[Spud (novel)|the 2005 novel]] by South African author [[John van de Ruit]].<ref name="stn" /> Filming took place in [[South Africa]] from early March to mid-April 2010.<ref>{{cite news |title = Spud's Young Stars |url = http://www.screenafrica.com/news/film/434162.htm |work = Screen Africa |date = 8 March 2010 |accessdate = 24 May 2010 |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5pxZ2wsF3 |archivedate = 24 May 2010 }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |first = John |last = Van de Ruit |title = Icarus Allsorts |url = http://johnvanderuit.book.co.za/blog/2010/04/20/icarus-allsorts/ |work = John van de Ruit's blog at Book South Africa |date = 20 April 2010 |accessdate = 24 May 2010 |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5pxbp5CrW |archivedate = 24 May 2010 }}</ref>
Sivan will appear in the West Australian season of [[Samuel Beckett]]'s absurdist play ''[[Waiting for Godot]]'' which opens on 28 May 2010. Sivan will share the role of "Boy" with Craig Hyde-Smith, alternating nights.<ref>{{cite news |title = Troye on stage with theatre great |first = Daniel |last = Hatch |url = http://au.news.yahoo.com/thewest/a/-/breaking/7281062/troye-on-stage-with-theatre-great/ |newspaper = [[The West Australian]] |page = 3 |date = 24 May 2010 |accessdate = 24 May 2010 |archiveurl = http://www.webcitation.org/5pxoNqRIv |archivedate = 24 May 2010 }}</ref>
